The provided code uses a dynamic programming approach with coordinate compression and two Fenwick trees (or segment trees) to update and query maximum values. The main loop iterates over the prefix sums and updates the dp array.

    nfen.modify(n+1-ordneg[i], dp[i]+i)

But then there is a TODO: update the dmx dictionary. The dmx dictionary is used to store the best dp value for a given prefix sum. So after computing dp[i], we should update dmx[pref[i]] to be the maximum of the current value and dp[i].
